definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it

sentences.english: Tom's friend said he was a double-tongued liar.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的朋友說他是個兩面三刀的騙子。

sentences.english: I knew that I am a genuine double-dealer.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，我纔是一個真正的兩面派。

sentences.english: Every option has its pros and cons.
sentences.chinese: 每一項選擇都具有正反兩面性。

sentences.english: When inflexible rules are imposed on flexible humans, both sides lose.
sentences.chinese: 當死板的規則強加在靈活的人類身上時，兩面皆輸。

sentences.english: I'm beginning to learn how two faced you are.
sentences.chinese: 我開始瞭解你是怎樣一個兩面三刀的人。

sentences.english: Paradox and discovery are two sides of the same coin.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾和發現是同一枚硬幣的兩面。

sentences.english: Love and pain are two sides of one coin, the coin of your emotional life.
sentences.chinese: 愛和痛是人的情感硬幣的正反兩面。

sentences.english: There isn’t one. The two sides of China are incommensurate.
sentences.chinese: 中國的兩面性並不匹配。

sentences.english: But Miller disappointed many by winning only two silvers, in the giant slalom and the combined, which features one downhill run and one slalom run.
sentences.chinese: 結果，米勒只得到兩面銀牌，令許多人大失所望。

sentences.english: The rig is one mast and two sails.
sentences.chinese: 這種船上有一根桅杆和兩面帆。

sentences.english: The die-hards of today are precisely such double-dealers.
sentences.chinese: 現在的頑固分子，就是這種兩面派。

sentences.english: Two aluminium alloy stanchions for accommodation ladder were lacked, to be provided.
sentences.chinese: 舷梯兩面沒有鉛合金支柱，請提供。

sentences.english: One ought to draw the positive and negative historical lessons.
sentences.chinese: 大家應當吸取正反兩面的歷史教訓。

sentences.english: After both sides are fried to a golden brown, add tomato sauce and Parmesan cheese.
sentences.chinese: 茄子兩面都變成焦黃色之後，加入番茄醬和巴馬乾酪。

sentences.english: Weigh the pros and cons of each choice.
sentences.chinese: 衡量每個選擇的正反兩面。

sentences.english: The party also walks a fine line in its proposed policies toward business.
sentences.chinese: 日本民主黨所提出的商業政策也是兩面不討好。

definition: both ends (of a stick etc)/two extremes
in general/more or less/in rough terms/basically/on the whole/overall situation/the big picture/(Tw) remains (of a dead person)
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
